abstract: Possible surge of Syrian refugees to United States has many South Carolina residents worried that newcomers will burden local government agencies or alter the character of their communities; World Relief has proposed resettling as many as 116 refugees in Upstate region of South Carolina in 2016.
lead_paragraph: The possibility of a wave of refugees has divided the state’s northwest corner, where critics worry they will burden services and alter the character of communities.

headline.main: Refugee Crisis in Syria Raises Fears in South Carolina
headline.print_headline: Fear Arrives in South Carolina Long Before Any Actual Syrians

snippet: The possibility of a wave of refugees has divided the state’s northwest corner, where critics worry they will burden services and alter the character of communities.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
